question:
You and your family are living in rented accommodation in an English speaking country. You are not satisfied with the condition of some of the furniture.
Write a letter to your friend. In your letter
-introduce yourself
-explain what is wrong with the furniture
-say what action you would like the landlord to take
Write at least 150 words.
You do NOT need to write any addresses.
Begin your letter as follows:
Dear ................. ,
text: I am writing this letter to express my dissatisfaction with the furniture which is presented in my rented flat.

I am Jenny Cornejo, one of your tenants in the Downtown building, room 504, fifth floor. I recently signed a rent agreement with you, and during that time you assure me that the furniture that I will be using during my 24 months stay has great quality furniture and other modern facilities.

However, please be informed that the quality of some of the items in my flat is poor. Firstly, the bed in the living area is causing an irritating sound when I am about to lay down. Secondly, one of the legs of the table in the dining area is broken. Lastly, the study table has draws which are totally jammed. In short, there are a lot of problems with these furniture items.
Thus, I would like to ask if you could replace it or schedule a carpenter to fix it. If it would not the case, I will withdraw my contract with you.
I hope you resolve this issue as soon as possible.
